title: Font recommendation?
content:
Does anyone have a recommendation for a fun, whimsical font (yet legible) for a girl’s 1st bday invitation? Thanks in advance!

-Meredith

 [‹ LT SC STD MM MP MTJB...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720063319/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44913 "Go to previous forum topic") [Static Text in Flash: Embedding? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720063319/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45030 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tarheel75

comments.content:
Yes, so many from the House Industries General Collection come to mind:  
 [http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=14&subpage=viewfonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080720063319/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=14&subpage=viewfonts "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=14&subpage=viewfonts")

like Dollhouse, Countryhouse and Funkhouse.

They have a testing space so you can see exactly how legible the fonts can be.  
While you are there - try Burbank - I just adore that family!

Countryhouse — isn’t that the font in the Happy Tree Friends cartoons?  
How old was that girl again? :-/
